resources.string: This device doesn\'t support Camera2 API.
added globally in the last 28 days
This function allows you to capture images of surveillance cameras to improve the object detection accuracy. After taking the image you will prompted to draw rectangles around surveillance cameras.
Please select an area for offline availability

- Offline mode disables ALL connections; OpenStreetMap maps will not render and need a x/y/z tile data from th internal storage to work.

 - Synchronization interval is the time between each update from the database server. Uploads will only take place with each synchronization interval. If you choose a long interval uploads might take longer than max delay.


OPTIONS BELOW ARE DISABLED
 - Min upload delay specifies the minimum time that has to pass after a camera is captured before the upload happens. This is to protect your privacy by giving you some time to leave the area before the camera appears in the database. You can always manually upload a camera before the time has passed.

 - Max upload delay specifies a limit to how much time passes at the maximum between a camera capture and the upload to the database.

This application needs some permissions to function properly. Absolutely no personal data is gathered.
- Storage permissions are needed to save images and read map data from your phone's storage.

 - Camera permission is needed to use the object detection model to automatically capture surveillance cameras.

 - Location permission is optional, but needed if you want to automatically capture surveillance cameras or center the map on your current position.

This application has different methods to capture and map surveillance cameras. 

- By default it uses a self trained object detection model to detect surveillance cameras through the device's camera. This mode uses the device's orientation and location to calculate the camera position. It's most accurate if you move by the camera and capture it from different angles. You can always edit the exact location in your local history before uploading. 

- You can choose to manually capture surveillance cameras. This can be set as the default method. 

- A third way is to capture training images to improve the object detection CURRENTLY NO UPLOAD 

 All these options are available via buttons from the default detection method
This project has been inspired by \nhttps://sunders.uber.space , new and more intrusive laws and the increasing amount of everyday surveillance\n
